page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area studied lies on the{ {Cheshire Plain. }It is a fairly flat area, mainly{agricultural,}with a predominance of dairy farming. Much of the remaining farmland is devoted to grain, potatoes and managed deciduous woodland. The land is drained by the Wincham Brook, a tributary of the River Weaver. Many of the fields have ponds, thought to be due to land subsidence because of underlying salt levels. The salt towns of Northwich and Winsford are nearby. The villages{Pickmere, Plumley, {Lostock Gralam and Wincham,}border the agricultural land. {Tabley,}a scattered agricultural village lies in the NE corner of the area. Pickmere Lake lies to the west and is a major recreational area.
